title: These 9 startups are betting that your gut is healthcare's next frontier, with millions in backing from investors like Marc Benioff and Vinod Khosla
text:
Can the data from our guts be turned into a useful health product?

That was the premise of two high-profile microbiome startups that shut down in recent months. To some researchers and investors, the failures suggested that it was simply too early to turn insights about the community of bacteria living in and on us into useful health products.

But some venture capitalists continue to see the microbiome as a lucrative opportunity. Among their ranks are well-known businesspeople like Marc Benioff and Vinod Khosla, as well as the venture arms of health institutions like the Mayo Clinic, Johnson & Johnson, and Illumina.

Most of the companies they are backing have a focus on creating new therapies for tough-to-treat conditions, like inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), diabetes, and even some cancers, according to data from CB Insights and PitchBook.

Take a look at the nine best-funded microbiome startups racing to turn insights from our guts into the next new blockbuster treatment.
description: Despite uBiome's failure, investors aren't giving up on the microbiome. Vinod Khosla and Marc Benioff are among the top names backing startups focused on the bacteria in your gut.
